Title: Senior Researcher, Product Experience (Growth)
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading streaming entertainment services, with over 260 million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films, and mobile games across various genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as they want, anytime, anywhere, and change their plans anytime.

The Product Experience Research team is central in uncovering compelling ways to engage and entertain our global members. This Senior Research role supports Growth, which strives to better attract new members to Netflix and explore new monetization opportunities worldwide. Specifically, this role will focus on how Netflix can deliver better value to more members through new ad-supported offerings.

This is an opportunity to lead innovative research with demonstrable impact on a global scale. You will be responsible for defining, leading, analyzing, and socializing research studies that generate insights to empower business decisions across the company. You’ll partner with cross-functional teams passionate about delivering the most engaging, innovative, and inclusive experiences.


In This Role, You Will

About You


Demonstrable experience in product research and/or user experience (UX) research informing growth and monetization strategy. Experience supporting subscription businesses or ad-supported online products preferred.Mixed methods research expertise including hands-on experience leading end-to-end quantitative and qualitative research studiesA balance of creative and analytical skills with the ability to proactively define research questions, identify appropriate methods, execute studies, and synthesize findings.Strong communicator with a bias toward action to proactively collaborate with multiple teams across the company.Passionate about translating findings into actionable strategic business recommendationsGlobal research experience is highly preferred but not required.

Bachelor's degree in business and/or Computer Science; OR 7+ years of equivalent work experience3+ years of experience leading a team of analysts or data scientists

Sompo is offering a distinctive opportunity for a Senior Global HR Data Analyst within our Talent Management Center of Excellence, situated in our Global Human Resources team.
The ideal candidate for this role will demonstrate a diverse skill set, encompassing proficiency in mining and manipulating extensive and diverse datasets, mastery of data software and visualization tools, and a knack for crafting compelling narratives from data insights. Additionally, collaboration and relationship-building are essential traits, as the candidate will need to work closely with various teams and stakeholders to effectively leverage data for informed decision-making.
Location: This position will be a hybrid role based out of our Boston Massachusetts office.
Our business, your impact, our opportunity:
What you’ll be doing:
Advanced Analysis:Conducting analysis of HR data using statistical methodologies such as regression analysis, hypothesis testing, and machine learning algorithms. You'll uncover nuanced patterns, correlations, and trends within HR datasets to extract actionable insights that drive strategic initiatives.
Data Visualization and Reporting:Harnessing the power of visualization tools like Workday Discovery Boards, Tableau or Power BI to create visually compelling dashboards and reports. Your aim is to translate complex analytical findings into easily understandable visual narratives, empowering HR professionals and key stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Communication and Storytelling:You'll articulate complex analytical findings in a clear and compelling manner, tailoring communication to resonate with diverse audiences across the organization. Developing visually engaging presentations and reports will distill complex insights into actionable recommendations, facilitating data-driven decision-making.
Technology and Tools:Staying at the forefront of HR analytics tools, you'll evaluate and implement software solutions to enhance data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities. Ensuring adherence to ethical guidelines and data privacy regulations is crucial to safeguard the integrity and confidentiality of sensitive employee data throughout the analytics process.


Collaboration and Consultation:Fostering collaborative partnerships with HR stakeholders, key internal partners, vendors, and business leaders is key. By understanding their unique requirements, you'll provide tailored analytical guidance and translate business challenges into actionable analytical approaches, delivering insights that drive outcomes and inform strategic direction.
Staying Updated on Industry Trends:Maintaining a pulse on industry trends and emerging best practices in people analytics is essential. You'll proactively incorporate innovative techniques to enhance analytical capabilities and contribute to thought leadership within the field of HR analytics, continuously elevating the organization's analytical maturity.
What you’ll bring:
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial / Organizational Psychology, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.
Minimum of seven (7) years of experience in HR analytics, data analysis, or a similar role, with a demonstrated track record of manipulating and analyzing large datasets.
Proficiency in data manipulation languages and data visualization tools (e.g., Workday Discovery Boards, Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into analytical solutions.
Excellent communication and storytelling abilities, with the capacity to convey complex data insights to diverse audiences in a clear and compelling manner.
Proven experience in strategic planning and project management, with the ability to balance long-term vision with tactical execution.Proficiency in establishing and developing analytics functions, coupled with a strong aptitude for influencing stakeholders across all levels. Description:
Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Our mission on the People Research & Insights team is to improve Stripe’s performance by understanding what’s moving the needle on our people strategy, clarifying the link between our people strategy and business outcomes, and using these insights to drive data-informed decisions throughout the employee lifecycle. We’re a collection of individuals with backgrounds in people science and organizational behavior, who are obsessed with delivering high-value output to our users.

What you’ll do

Responsibilities

Use qualitative and quantitative research methods to contribute valuable insights to our evolving people processes and programs.Develop and present comprehensive storylines from organizational data, influencing and enabling decision-making for leaders.Articulate and present complex research findings effectively to diverse audiences ranging from program designers to executives.Design, implement, and evaluate complex organizational interventions to enhance the growth and success of Stripes.Collaborate seamlessly with cross functional partner teams, internal stakeholders, and business leaders, using data and insights to inform decisions.Leverage structured and unstructured data efficiently to support key organizational initiatives and processes.


Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements

Master’s or Doctoral degree in a field emphasizing the science of human behavior at work (e.g., Organizational Behavior, Industrial/Organizational Psychology, or a related field).5+ years of experience conducting research in an organization or consulting environment, including formulating questions with customers, collecting and analyzing data, generating insights, and sharing results with various types of audiences.Proficient in organizational research methodology, statistics, predictive analytics, and statistical programming software (e.g., R or Python).Ability to manage competing priorities and timelines to deliver high-quality solutions, as-promised and on-timeExperience communicating technical concepts clearly, with all audiences.Flexible and comfortable with ambiguity (our environment changes rapidly, and your work might too!).Stay up to date on best practices, scientific findings, and case studies in the world of people science.


Working remotely at Stripe

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual US base salary range for this role is $147,300 - $221,000. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

Description:
At Klaviyo, we value the unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives each Klaviyo (we call ourselves Klaviyos) brings to our workplace each and every day. We believe everyone deserves a fair shot at success and appreciate the experiences each person brings beyond the traditional job requirements. We are seeking a Director, People Analytics to enhance our exceptional team. This role involves crafting and executing a robust People Analytics strategy, leading a team to deliver actionable insights and forward-thinking solutions to meet Klaviyo's people objectives. Reporting to the Head of Total Rewards, you will be instrumental in advancing our People Analytics capabilities, integrating data from various platforms like Culture Amp, Greenhouse, and Workday to create a comprehensive and secure analytical framework. Your mission is to transform data into compelling narratives that inform strategic decisions, driving organizational health and development.

The ideal candidate will be data-driven and passionate about using it for organizational success. You should have a strong background in people analytics, with a proven ability to integrate and interpret data from various sources to craft compelling narratives and inform decision-making. This individual will excel in transforming insights into strategic actions, demonstrating a deep understanding of the impact of people data on business outcomes.

How You’ll Drive Impact

Be a storyteller. Tell the narrative of what matters most with data and insights that drives Klaviyo further.Using technical expertise to ensure we have a solution to bring together our engagement survey data (Culture Amp), recruiting data (Greenhouse), and People Data (Workday) in a secure manner. Monitor and recommend changes to improve data quality.Implement regular and automated Organizational Health checks via dashboard and benchmarks and use the data to build a narrative, drive insights, and influence initiatives. Act as an internal consultant by understanding business needs, scoping data requests, synthesizing insights, and recommending solutions to key business partners in collaboration with other members of analytics teams. Apply expertise in people research and qualitative/quantitative analysis to identify opportunities for optimizing employee performance, engagement, diversity, management and leadership development, and retention.Lead organizational wide change management initiatives and programs (in partnership and collaboration with COEs, HRBPs, etc.) including recognition & rewards, workforce location strategy, and/or other large scale cross-functional initiatives. Partner closely with Talent Management, L&D, and HRBPs to ensure engagement surveys are analyzed and presented to the business. Ensure our engagement survey data is connected back to talent management, learning, and DEI trends. Partner with the People Leadership team and support the Chief People Officer in preparations materials for Leadership Team and Board Meetings. Apply expertise in qualitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and help inform, influence, support against business priorities. Work with key stakeholders to determine the appropriate sentiment strategies via surveys or other research methods to deliver valuable business insights. Lead and implement survey design to measure sentiment across employee lifecycle.Deliver high quality analysis, reports, presentations using simple and effective visualizations that can be scaled for consumption by a larger audience

Who You Are

Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field, Masters degree preferred (or equivalent experience) and 8+ years of experience in a quantitative or analytics role within a Human Resources organization.Experience leading and developing a team of people analytics professionals.Expertise in collecting and using data to inform decision-making and persuade others. Prior experience working with a People Analytics tool such as Visier. Proficiency in Excel and other data tools is important. You are intellectually curious. You have strong analytical skills, proven experience understanding and effectively using data and metrics to implement processes/workflows. You enjoy building things and continually strive to do things better than the status quo. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail.Expertise in statistical analysis (regression, correlation, scenario analysis, forecasting, and experimentation (A/B) testing Willing to take on the tough projects and challenges to grow and develop.

This role is eligible for benefits, including: medical, dental and vision coverage, health savings accounts, flexible spending accounts, 401(k), flexible paid time off and company-paid holidays and a culture of learning that includes a learning allowance and access to a professional coaching service for all employees.

Title: Analytics Manager, PINS
Description:
Position Overview

We're seeking an Analytics Manager for PINS (Payee Identification and Network Security) to join our team, reporting to the Senior Director. In this role, you'll lead the PINS analytics team and drive the development of a structured analytics program. Your focus will be on managing ongoing and ad-hoc reporting, automation, and operational enhancements for the PINS team, ensuring data accuracy and consistent reporting. You'll also implement strategies to translate raw data into actionable insights for decision-making within the PINS department and across functional teams.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement a structured analytics program, including training, onboarding, and testing of skills for analysts, and documentation of reporting requirementsPrioritize requests from the PINS department and stakeholders, ensuring capture of business cases and effective management of deliverablesTransform raw data into meaningful business insights for decision-making and strategic planningPrepare data summaries and detailed reports for leadership, identifying trends, patterns, areas of concern, and overall business insightsEnsure accuracy of data and deliverables through established policies and processesCollaborate with data and analytics professionals to optimize and scale the PINS team, ensuring continuity of reporting and dashboardsIdentify areas for process improvements, including automation, dashboard development, and visualization toolsEnhance reporting of department KPIs and SLAs to provide visibility into team accomplishments and areas for improvementProvide detailed explanation and training to end-users of reporting and dashboardsManage day-to-day requests, enhancements, and tasks for yourself and your team, ensuring alignment with current departmental prioritiesThink creatively to solve complex problems and adapt dynamically to changing risks and business needs

Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in business and/or Computer Science; OR 7+ years of equivalent work experience3+ years of experience leading a team of analysts or data scientists

Preferred Qualifications

Advanced modeling skills in SQL, Python, or comparable query language competenciesHighly analytical and proficient with database and visualization tools such as Tableau and/or Power BIStrong Excel skills, including formulas, vlookups, and conditional formattingAbility to mine complex datasets and generate actionable business recommendationsAdaptability to change and effective response in a fast-paced, deadline-focused environmentProficiency in data-driven decision-making and storytellingExperience in fraud or risk prevention

As a leading payments company in healthcare, we guide, price, explain, and pay for care on behalf of insurers and their members. We’re Zelis in our pursuit to align the interests of payers, providers, and consumers to deliver a better financial experience and more affordable, transparent care for all. We partner with more than 700 payers, including the top-5 national health plans, BCBS insurers, regional health plans, TPAs and self-insured employers, over 4 million providers, and 100 million members, enabling the healthcare industry to pay for care, with care.
